23.text: During the school holidays I organise family activities in the community centre and I support Big Local

31.text: I'm the Brookside Big Local secretary. I take minutes. Help with any organizing events that

39.text: they need. Just general back up really.

44.text: I normally do the till but i have done the kitchen.

46.text: Doing the pot wash. It helps the community. It keeps the cafe going as well as keeping the kitchen open.

54.text: I help Sarah Penn with Brookside Events Group, making little activities

58.text:
for the kids aged 0 to probably about 10
or 11. This year we've got Halloween

Party coming up. Round communities
normally there's not really a lot of Halloween stuff so what we do

69.text:
we make it so we've got places for the
kids to come, enjoy and obviously have fun.

76.text: I'm a Community Involvement Volunteer. I basically run the reception desk. I help the girls with

83.text: any admin tasks that need doing. I could do anything from admin to sorting bookshelves out. Help with

91.text: community projects. Anything really that they need help with.

93.text: I help out in the market garden. Do a bit of gardening.

99.text: Do planting and plenty of weeding and mainly grow veg for the cafe and the wider community.

107.text: I help with the planning of events,

109.text:
community events. I helped with the
background and the planning of the

113.text: Brookside Community Centre..the celebration of Brookside. And I was here, I was stewarding on the day

118.text:
which was great to see
everybody out and bringing everyone together.

122.text:
I actually run Brookside Events Group.
We're just a small group of single moms and we

128.text:
we do events, mainly for children but
would do try and do it the whole of the

132.text: community. We've done Summer Fairs, Easter Egg Hunts. We've got a Halloween disco coming

138.text:
up on the thirtieth. We do pub
quizes for the adults so everybody gets a

142.text:
little bit. We also have our
hands in all the different projects as

148.text: well such as Let's Grow,  Big..where we get our funding from. So we do try and entail ourselves

154.text:
in a little bit of everything. My
confidence levels like I said I've gone

157.text: from here to here. My involvement, I've learned more. The people that have come to know. It's absolutely fantastic.

166.text: I'm having fun, basically. There's a sense of purpose

171.text:
there's a sense of achievement but for
the most part I'm having fun and I'm

178.text: often heard to say that the best job I've ever had is retirement

181.text:
if you get involved in your
community then you have a sense of

184.text: belonging because, as you can see I'm not English (Scottish accent)

188.text:
I'm a single mum of two young children. I get the enjoyment knowing there's things
for young kids

194.text: I get a buzz because I know I'm making them happy.

198.text: And it's just letting kids grow up knowing they've got a safe place to go.

201.text: I've lived on Brookside all my life. it's my way of giving something back to the community and it's something I really enjoy doing

208.text: I like meeting people,  talking to people. I like helping people. It's things like that, really.

213.text: Plenty of enjoyment, fresh air and a healthier lifestyle.

220.text: Well, I've just secured a job and I start on Monday. and I've gained confidence.

224.text: You just get a sense that you're doing something good and it's nice.

229.text: Seeing the smiles on the kid's faces when we've done this stuff has been like..you can't even explain it. In some cases I've cried because it's just like WoW so

238.text: but yeah, so, yeah..it's pretty good.
